website_summaries.verdict: A first-rate stand that will safeguard your iPad against scratches and scuffs.
pros: Rubber pads on the surface of the stand help protect your iPad from damage
Includes 6 adjustable slots for added convenience
Can be instantly folded up flat for easy transport
Comes in a variety of attractive colors
cons: Stand is flimsy and fragile, and its overall construction leaves much to be desired

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a trip to use on a plane but I've found that I've incorporated it into my every day carry since it provides so much functionality at a bare minimum cost of space in my pockets. I'm pleasantly surprised. This is the best smart phone stand. - Collapsible design means I can carry it in my pocket with my wallet. - Adjustable viewing angles. - Rubber feet give it a nice grip on any surface. - Rubber cradle ensures that your phone doesn't slip around while in the stand
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Great product and customer service
customer_reviews.text: These phone stands are awesome! We use them with an iPhone 7 in an otter box case and it holds up great. They fold flat and fit in your pocket easily. I bought one for me and two for my sisters. We even ordered two extras to leave in the living room and on the patio. Great for streaming movies or watching funny clips together! Cool simple design and great customer service! One stand we received had a loose pin and they sent us a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon customer

customer_reviews.title: Piece of garbage. Not much larger than credit card
customer_reviews.text: Piece of garbage. Not much larger than credit card. Doesn’t hold iPhone or tablet which is what I needed. Very deceptive picture. Bad bad bad. Oohhh. And it’s not eligible for return. Thank goodness Amazon stands behind things sold. Stay away from this product. But we love Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: What a WASTE, use a blanket!!!
customer_reviews.text: The first one got lost in shipment, I reordered patiently. It was late again! I sleep with my phone as a personal tv and thought this would hold it up on my pillow. It just kept falling over forward pr collapsing every time I touched it or sometimes without reason. Cheap piece of junk. Wish I could still return it! Hadn't found anything better before the return window closed. Save yourself time and hassle. It will fold up, my son could construct something better!!!! Still laying on the floor because I refuse to put any more energy into it!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mike Andre

customer_reviews.title: Rubber Nibs Fall Off, Stand Slides Around
customer_reviews.text: I would give this 5 stars, if the little rubber nibs on the bottom did not fall off BOTH the units I ordered. Without the nibs, it slips and slides around when you use your finger on the phone. Otherwise, this compact unit is very well designed for small tablets and phones, but until the nib problem is corrected. I would look elsewhere. I'm going to try the stand from Anker next. The one I tried from iKross (they make several) was good for phones, but the ledge was too small for even small tablets. Pretty soon, I'll be able to write a book on these things. ;-)
customer_reviews.author: Pickle Paul

customer_reviews.title: Love It
customer_reviews.text: Picture makes this stand look small sized. Actually it is VERY, VERY small, but a good size for my Kindle Voyager. It is strong and sturdy. I can set it on my lap while reading, which leaves my hands free for my coffee cup or snacks....or jotting notes or whatever. I'm glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Everyone should have one
customer_reviews.text: I originally purchased 2 as stocking stuffers and now purchased 2 more. It folds flat into a 3x3x1/4 inch square that can easily be slipped into my purse for traveling. When standing it has strong support by the nubs & slots are set perfect. The slot that holds my phone has a rubber grip strip so my phone doesn't slide around when I use my touch screen. Even though it is small and can be easily moved, I have purchased the additional 2 for other rooms in my house. I like to set my phone in this at my desk when I work on my computer so I can quickly see if there are messages I need to address.
customer_reviews.author: Angeles E Oakes

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly useful given its size
customer_reviews.text: I bought this intending to use it for our tablet, which is suddenly getting much more use now that three kids are trying to do school from home during the pandemic. When it arrived, I was taken aback by it's small size - it's barely the size of my phone. I didn't expect it would be able to hold the tablet at all. To my surprise, it actually works quite well - both for phone and tablet. We've used it for kid Zoom sessions and watching movies. I wouldn't trust it for something interactive like online schooling in which you'd need to repeatedly tap on the device, but for ordinary watching / video chats, it works great.
customer_reviews.author: A Mom of 3

customer_reviews.title: Super light and compact but can handle big devices
customer_reviews.text: This is a road warrior's dream. It weighs next to nothing and folds down to a tiny thing. I can easily hold up my Samsung Galaxy S8 phone, my 9" Samsung Galaxy Tab S3 tablet and even my Asus ZenScreen 15" monitor (MB16AC) in landscape mode (the mode I use the most). It can hold the ZenScreen in portrait mode but it can easily tip over if bumped so I wouldn't recommend that.
customer_reviews.author: TB

customer_reviews.title: WHAT A GREAT LITTLE DEVICE!
customer_reviews.text: I have an Ipad Mini with a thick case that used to hold a keyboard. I took the keyboard off, but I love the case, which has an easel that lets me view the tablet horizontally, but not vertically. I've been looking for something that would allow me to do that, but that wasn't bulky, as I wanted it to fit in the case, which had room because of the removed keyboard. This fits the bill amazingly! The ledge the tablet sits on is wide enough to fit my tablet without removing the case! It's sturdy, too, and won't fall over when I touch the screen a lot. I just love this and am so glad I found it!
customer_reviews.author: CarolynCAG

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: This is a neat little stand that doesn't take up much desk space, and it hold my devices securely, even with a pop socket on the back of my phone case. Use in either Landscape or Portrait mode, either way you want to position your phone or iPad (I have an iPad mini). There are actually 7 different positions to choose from, 5 with slots, so it's easy to adjust the angle, and that is a plus for choosing the best one for watching video and using a video chat app. It's also easier to find my phone when it's in the stand where it belongs. It's sturdy and should last a long, long time.
customer_reviews.author: CactusMomma

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for phone- okay for tablet.
customer_reviews.text: I had initially purchased this for my iPad mini. It's a little too top-heavy for me to use it in portrait mode, but it's serviceable in landscape (it will "stand" in portrait, but if I touch it, it wants to fall over). However, lately I have been using it with my phone (iPhone 6S), and I feel that it's much more suited to a device that size. It's rock-solid (even with a Popsocket on!), and displays the phone's screen nicely on my desk or nightstand.
customer_reviews.author: Bethani

customer_reviews.title: An "air warrior" must!
customer_reviews.text: Flying 100-120,000 miles a year, this has been an excellent addition to my travel gear! For those flights with personal device entertainment, this perfectly supports my Samsung Galaxy 8 in its Incipio case or my iPhone 7 in an Ottorbox Commuter and sitting on the tray table. I'm frequently asked where I found this stand! Fits easy into a pocket in my laptop courier bag along with my earbuds.
customer_reviews.author: RSV

customer_reviews.title: Great find
customer_reviews.text: I'm so glad I found this inexpensive but perfect stand for holding my Kindle Fire tablet. At first I could only find the heavier, much-more expensive type of stand that looks sort of like a large hockey puck with a slot in it. But after a wider search, I found this fold-up one that was so much cheaper that I was a little concerned about it's sturdiness and stability. But after using it for a few weeks, I'm totally satisfied with it, and am certain it will hold up for a long time to come, probably longer than my tablet!
customer_reviews.author: Szxvp

customer_reviews.title: Thin, lightweight, holds my Galaxy S7 perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great stand. I use it for my Galaxy S7. It's thin and completely flat for traveling and folds out to a solid stand. It's plastic but so far has been durable after about 2 months of use. It has multiple slots that allow a great range of tilt for your phone. For example if you are getting glare on your screen you can easily change the angle to prevent glare. It doesn't slide but seems like it would stay still in most places. I have not tried it on anywhere with vibration or a seat back on an Airplane. I watch with my phone horizontially so charging my phone with a cable is never a problem.
customer_reviews.author: NotChineseNotHiredByCompany

customer_reviews.title: Excellent portable device stand
customer_reviews.text: Works great with phone in landscape or portrait, strong/study enough to hold my 12in tab without there being any close calls or accidents. The cradle is also deep enough for an encased phone, but not a battery case, though it still holds my phone fine with the phone itself overhanging. I love that it folds flatter than a slim wallet and is just the right size for wherever I want to stash it. I do prefer an articulated metal stand at home, but for price and portability this really can't be beat.
customer_reviews.author: K. Thornton

customer_reviews.title: Object may be smaller than appears
customer_reviews.text: A reasonable small stand for iPhone, iPad, etc... Unfortunately it errs on the small side. It should have been advertised for just the phones and not the tablets, as it is a little less stable on the larger platforms, especially when you consider they are touch screens and we are touching them all the time. It does the job of being a vertical (portrait) stand for iPad. The case we had already gave us a horizontal (landscape) stand. For reading books in single page mode, it made more sense to get a portrait stand. The price was right and it was delivered on time. Perhaps they should consider making a slightly larger, more stable, version for iPad and other tablets.
customer_reviews.author: E. Magnin

customer_reviews.title: Handy, strong,
customer_reviews.text: The holder is very handy, I have been looking for something like for a long time (with no success). I like to listen music or watch/hear movies while I am working in the kitchen. I have my Iphone (XS Max) on the kitchen counter, and the best thing is to hold my Iphone on this holder. It is strong enough to hold my Iphone XsMax, I was afraid that it was not going to work, but it did. It is amazing. Also I have a lot of video calls and it is great because I place the Iphone and I can do things while I speak with my family members via videocalls.
customer_reviews.author: ILEANA MARGARITA

customer_reviews.title: One of my favorite phone accessories.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to try it out as a portable stand for my phone. I was so happy with its function and portability i ordered more. It fits my iPhone 7 plus with Otterbox case better than any other phone stand i've had. its great for when i'm working on music or watching a Video. I have told many of my friends and family about it. i know it seems silly to promote a phone stand like that but i am actually that pleased with this product. it is not made of metal or anything super durable but it has held up to being tossed in my bad and taken all over. I really like this Product.
customer_reviews.author: Bartholomew Sciacca

customer_reviews.title: Small. Better for a smaller device/case
customer_reviews.text: I didn't realize how small this was until I received it. It seems great for a phone, but tips over backwards when trying to use with an iPad in portrait mode. Greatest for packing flat (collapsed) into a bag or shirt pocket. Sigh. After some use, the wife unit realized it is just too unstable. Then again, she has a bulky case for her phone. I could have given if 5 stars if it was not represented as tablet capable. I wish they made a bigger unit for tablets.
customer_reviews.author: Arty

customer_reviews.title: Works well with 13" Tablet
customer_reviews.text: I used two of these stands to create a dual-monitor setup for travel using two Dell 7350 2-in-1's. These are 13" tablets, and the stands were able to hold the tablets steady at a good viewing angle, allowing for touchscreen use without becoming unstable. I primarily used a bluetooth mouse, so my touchscreen use was minimal. The tablet stand folds very flat and thin, with the exception of a small lip. It fits easily into the pocket of a tablet case. I left the Dell keyboards at home and brought a folding bluetooth keyboard, which fit into one of the tablet cases along with the stand. Tablet case:  Bluetooth keyboard:  Bluetooth mouse:
customer_reviews.author: Eric Nielsen

customer_reviews.title: smaller than i expected = less stable
customer_reviews.text: I thought this would be useful to occasionally watch a video on the ipad while in bed or the recliner - but the product is pretty small. Perhaps it is explicit in the description and I should have know how big (or small) it was - but something about the photo made me feel that it was closer to the size of the ipad and would therefore offer good support and stability. The product is about the size of an index card - so in comparison to the size of the ipad, it just can't offer the stability that I prefer. It is probably terrific for a phone though.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer L. Black

customer_reviews.title: The future we were promised
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, this is the coolest little gadget I’ve bought in a long time. Unfolding it and watching it perfectly align to become a useful product feels like living in an origami cyberpunk futurescape. It’s sturdy, machined with uncompromising precision, and beautiful in a utilitarian way. Sure, the world may be going to hell, but at least I have a phone stand that can be folded almost as flat as a credit card.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Dunham

customer_reviews.title: A tiny accessory provides great value
customer_reviews.text: I'm traveling more these days, and i like to watch movies on my phone while stuck on planes or in the lounge. The MoKo stand makes this so much more pleasant, holding my phone at just the right angle. (BTW, the angle is adjustable.) An added benefit are the non-slip feet which, how to put it...don't slip! Even on a tilted tray table or bumpy ride, my phone stays securely where i put it. For less than $6, you can hardly do better!
customer_reviews.author: Ben Delaney

customer_reviews.title: Bought twice; both broke within a short time
customer_reviews.text: This is a simple gadget that does just one thing: it creates a stand for your cell phone. I have now bought two of these. The first one broke after two or three months. The latest one broke after only a month. It isn't like I use it that often, but it broke in the same place: the hinge at the top of the stand. This is an inexpensive stand. I'm sure there are others out there that wouldn't break so easily.
customer_reviews.author: JustAThought

customer_reviews.title: Cheap enough to buy. Durable enough to not worry
customer_reviews.text: Nice little stand for your money. Seems to be really durable. I got the black one and I've accidentally sat on it a few times already. Other than the 2 little tiny pegs on the bottom of the back brace breaking, nothing is wrong with it. And even without them pegs, it stays put at the angle I want. Would be nice if it my phone could actually be clipped onto the stand instead of just laid there, but that's just me nitpicking. Worth the buy
customer_reviews.author: Jahknee

customer_reviews.title: Nice little addition to my travel bag
customer_reviews.text: There isn't much to say about this. It's a little gadget that helps you prop up your phone, and it works as advertised. Folds up flat so takes up very little space in my travel bag. I use it only to prop up my phone on the nightstand in hotel rooms when I use my phone as an alarm clock. Charging cable won't fit under the phone if in portrait mode so I use it in landscape, which works great as an alarm clock.
customer_reviews.author: mix579

customer_reviews.title: This thing is amazing. Buy it.
customer_reviews.text: Perfectly designed, love that it folds flat when not in use, love that the angle is adjustable. I use it for my phone vertically and horizontally. Great for watching shows in the kitchen while cooking and doing dishes, and for my desk for video calls, or for watching shows while doing mundane work at my desk. Really impressed, and the price is great for the value. Just bought a 2nd one.
customer_reviews.author: blue

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product.
customer_reviews.text: I normally do a PROS and CONS list, but there are only pros to this item. - The quality is nice, and sturdy - The angles can be adjusted to fit whatever angle you need your device at. - Fits practically anywhere - VERY versatile I love that the lip at the bottom is large enough to fit practically any device. I have a samsung with a speck case and it fits fine You can fit tablets galore and even a laptop which I tested just for fun.
customer_reviews.author: RU1SmutShoppa2

customer_reviews.title: Does the job for the price without question.
customer_reviews.text: Not the best if you keep your tablet in a certain types of cases as they increase the thickness. I have an iPad Air (latest) but it does a decent job more or less of its say on there correct. For the price, I won’t really complain. Also a bit small. Seems it will last for a good bit though and size just makes it more convenient for packing up for travel.
customer_reviews.author: Incredible kluH

customer_reviews.title: A superb stand
customer_reviews.text: This is truly a remarkable stand for smartphones and tablets and has come in so handy that I've since bought one for every room. It holds virtually every phone and tablet out there at adjustable angles, and it holds them securely with no slipping or tipping over. Whether reading during a meal, having a video chat and want to keep your hands free, or for a million other uses, I wouldn't want to be without this stand.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Norton

customer_reviews.title: What I wanted
customer_reviews.text: Made of plastic but definitely not flimsy. Folds nicely and no parts seem loose or easy to break (within regularly use and reason). Using this for my Nexus 6p. Large phones like the iPhone 6+, Nexus 6P or whatever else you have will fair well. I also tried this with my surface pro 3 which is 12in in diameter. Obviously my surface already has a kickstand so it doesn't need this, but this little stand is sturdy enough to hold it. However, i would not recommend this product for a tablet of this size. It is not wide enough for this application.
customer_reviews.author: Joel A.

customer_reviews.title: Small, Flat, and Stable
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little stand that works well with my iPhone 7+, iPad mini, and 10.5" iPad Pro. Sturdy with all devices in portrait or landscape mode with or without cases. The size is awesome and it folds down so nicely that it fits in a pocket fairly flat! It's also nice to be able to set it at different angles, depending on your need. Highly recommend for the price - I'll be purchasing a couple more. Great stocking stuffers. *Pictured with 10.5" iPad Pro.
customer_reviews.author: Rock

customer_reviews.title: Horrible product
customer_reviews.text: Cheep and much smaller than the dimensions shown on the website. They say it is 6 x 8 at best it is 2" x 3" and very very poor quality. They also do not accept returns however Amazon was wonderful in working with me. I would highly discourage anyone from purchasing this product or any product from this company.
customer_reviews.author: steve puckett

customer_reviews.title: Small but works very well
customer_reviews.text: I was shocked when I received these stands because I expected them to be much larger, however they work really well and size has not been an issue. It is my fault for not reading the product description. I don’t think a larger one would function any better, honestly these are great and the smaller size makes it easy to put in your purse or pocket.
customer_reviews.author: KAT VON

customer_reviews.title: I use it to put my 10" Fire tablet in "show mode" and it works just fine
customer_reviews.text: This holds my new 10" Fire tablet when I'm watching videos or have it in show mode. I have a case with a cover on my tablet, and it barely fits, but it does fit. I really like the adjustable angle so I can have it on my desk or on top of my printer depending on if I want to lean back in my chair or not. I'm 100% satisfied with this stand. It holds the biggest device I have without any problem, so of course it holds the rest of them too.
customer_reviews.author: Jack HTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Just what we needed!
customer_reviews.text: These are cool! Got one for me and one for hubby. They definitely hold our larger LG phones. A bit pricey in my opinion, it's a piece of plastic for goodness sake! You have to figure out how to unfold it. Anyway, it's exactly what we needed. Especially for travel. They shipped in Prime time. The black one came separately. It wasn't packaged very well. Thank God it didn't get damaged in shipping. For that fact, don't know if I will order from this seller again. The lilac one came in with other purchased items in a box. Would recommend this type phone stand. Works good!
customer_reviews.author: MissKittyfromGA

customer_reviews.title: Landscape only for Tablets.  Portrait or Landscape for phones.
customer_reviews.text: While the text says it's good for a tablet as well as a phone, this is actually sized for a phone. It only is secure for a tablet if the tablet is in landscape format. Portrait has too high a center of gravity and it will tip over. If you don't mind the landscape limitation (I can live with it since I use it to read ebooks) this is a good choice.
customer_reviews.author: Avid Reader

customer_reviews.title: Very handy, always with me!
customer_reviews.text: This is a slim, lightweight stand that feels of decent quality in the hand. I've held others that just feel cheap, but this one actually has some substance to it and I like that. It never broke, even though I'm hard on my gadgets and stands and most of my stuff, really. Very stable, though it will slip a little on some surfaces because the rubber feet are tiny. But, that's easily fixed with a bit of DIY ingenuity. Very nice, and I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I use these for all my handheld game systems, and my kindle tablet.
customer_reviews.text: I guess I don't use these in the way they were intended to be used, but I use them almost every day. Instead of putting my devices on them while I'm using the device, I use them as a place to set my devices when I'm not using them, and when I'm charging them. I don't ever want to be without these again. I bought 3 for myself, and 1 for my Mom, and I'm going to buy a few more for back ups, in case anything ever happens to the ones I'm using. My Mom uses hers when she's reading books or playing games on her tablet. I hope someone makes these things forever.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Simple, convenient and worth it!
customer_reviews.text: I got this stand for when I facetime my family/friends and to use my phone as a timer for when I study. It works perfectly and adjusts to different viewing angles when I also want to watch a video. My days of putting my phone against a book or other inanimate objects and hoping it doesn't fall screen first are long gone! Great purchase, would certainly recommend it for anyone who doesn't want to add a pop socket or another type of stand.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Cuevas

customer_reviews.title: Good product, great price
customer_reviews.text: I didn't look at the dimensions before ordering so I was a bit surprised by how small this stand is. BUT, it is a good product, made of heavy plastic, folds flat, has multiple angles, and holds well. It doesn't fit my new otterbox type case, but works perfect without the case. I don't think this should be advertised for a 7" or larger sized tablet, but it would be perfect for a cell phone.
customer_reviews.author: Finley family

customer_reviews.title: Works great, and can't go wrong for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little stand. It looks a lot bigger on Amazon but is much smaller than the picture makes it looks like. That said, it works perfectly and folds up into a light weight, and very portable phone stand. One thing, if you order it with something else and they send them together make sure you don't throw it out by mistake. I didn't realize it was in with the other package I ordered (and because it's so small and lightweight) I almost threw it away. I accidentally felt it when I was throwing the package out.
customer_reviews.author: douglas martin

customer_reviews.title: This is one tablet holder that just "works".
customer_reviews.text: When I found it at the bottom of a large box of some other items I bought, I thought, "Well this is a waste." but after putting my Shield tablet in it it's more sturdy than the larger folding holder I have with 3 arms. In fact for being so tiny it's amazing how well it holds the tablet and the soft rubber or silicone pads on the bottom keep it from sliding on the desk. This is one tablet holder that just "works".
customer_reviews.author: JerryEl

customer_reviews.title: Neat Item
customer_reviews.text: I don't always write reviews but I love this little 'gadget' so much that after receiving the first one, I ordered another one! Works great with my Android phone. I had been using one of the suction cup style holders that attaches to the back of the phone, but the problem is my phone case has to be removed as it will not attach to it. This type works so much better and I like the idea that it folds up, is lightweight and I can carry it in my purse.
customer_reviews.author: Peg Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Cute little Stand!
customer_reviews.text: When I received my package, I was really Shocked by the size. I was in disbelief til I got my tablet out and put it on the stand this little Product worked just fine. I wanted it for laying down for bed due to my tablet would Always slide down off my pillow. Cute and worth the price! 😊
customer_reviews.author: Te Te

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: This cell phone stand meets all my desires for propping up my phone to read. If I am charging the phone at the same time, I simply place it horizontally so that the cord is on the side. It is sturdy plastic, with 5 slots to incline at various angles. When folded, it is just a bit larger than a credit card -- easy to stick in a purse or a pocket (though I am not sure if it would break if one sat down with it in a pocket!). Glad I bought this.
customer_reviews.author: Gwendolyn L. Hill

customer_reviews.title: MoKo Phone Stand is a Good Buy
customer_reviews.text: This stand is perfect for my HTC Desire 626 cell phone. It is built well and is very compact when folded up. I can slide the stand in my pocket or put in the cell phone travel case if I wish. My cell phone with its case is just short of 1.5 cm thick and it just fits in the stand's bottom shelf that supports the phone. It is light weight, but think it will last if not abused. I could not be happier w/ this product that cost less than $6 w/ free shipping from Amazon Prime.
customer_reviews.author: Gaetano B

customer_reviews.title: Great Cell phone stsnd
customer_reviews.text: Great little stand....perfect for my cell phone...folds up really small and unfolds easily. Constructed very well. I was really impressed on the design and construction. Built strong not flimsy so it won't break. and finally I don't know what the feet are made of but they stick to a surface and won't slide. Exceeded my expectations ..and that does not hspen often on things I purchase....
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: It will in my pants or shirt pocket for easy travel.
customer_reviews.text: The tilt angle is preset via notches in the plastic but there are numerous notches to find a suitable tilt angle. It appears that this plastic will withstand a bit of pressure, so durability is not an issue. The base is wide enough that I am able to place it on my mattress and use my tablet.
customer_reviews.author: spinetingler

customer_reviews.title: Really good for the price.
customer_reviews.text: It's actually a pretty good stand. I use it to hold a roughly 8 inch tablet that's set up to be a clock in a room and it does it's job. It is cheap, but surprisingly sturdy for this purpose. I don't take the tablet on and off of the stand often at all, so I can't vouch for how it would hold up with repeated movement.
customer_reviews.author: erik s.

customer_reviews.title: Works with phones, tablets, Nintendo Switch, and more!
customer_reviews.text: This little stand is so small, but it packs a punch! So far I've tried it with a Samsung Galaxy S7 Edge with a case and pop socket on it, a Samsung Galaxy S6 with a thick case, a Nintendo Switch screen, and an iPad 2, and it holds all of them up wonderfully. The adjustable angles are quite convenient, and it's also perfect for travelling with since it's so compact! I'll be buying another one for travel use. Definitely recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Chai

customer_reviews.title: Love this little stand
customer_reviews.text: Like how this stand is so small yet so strong, I got it for my cell phone but it can support my 10 inch Kindle Fire and still fold down to practically nothing. I carry it in my purse and use it at my job. Very pleased with it...price was awesome too! UPDATE: 4/28/19-Had misplaced my original stand so purchased 2 more as extras. New ones I received were larger than my first one which I wasn't expecting but it's okay because it supports my Kindle better, and they're just as portable as my other one (which I found...YAY!!)
customer_reviews.author: Idolleo 64

customer_reviews.title: WAY to small to use with an iPad pro
customer_reviews.text: bought this to use for my son with his school iPad pro. Between being small and not offering enough space to accommodate any type of case, this was a complete waste of money. Works great for iPhones, but should not be listed as compatible with anything larger than an iPhone.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron J. Sheldon

customer_reviews.title: Completely love this stand!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect! I have an iPhone XS Max and I have the Otter PopSockets Case on it. It still fits great. Something so small and simple can help so much. Even if it broke, I would still purchase another. Although it seems highly unlikely that it would break unless I was too rough with it.
customer_reviews.author: Destroyess

customer_reviews.title: Buy it ! Zoom on it for hands free
customer_reviews.text: It’s a good looking object Cute and sturdy Mine is black Can’t believe how useful it’s been Angel and tilt can be adjusted Folds up to travel in pocketbook for travel on airplane ( in times of covid what’s an airplane? ) Excellent value for price May order a 4 pack to gift to friends ( don’t see them anymore )
customer_reviews.author: Rsb

customer_reviews.title: It is build with cheap plastic
customer_reviews.text: I'm so disappointed when I received the product. It built with a cheap plastic like in 99 Cents store. It will break in on time. I'm not sure how can I keep this stand. At lease, build it with Metal or Aluminum. The size is a little bit small for the Tablet. I may return it back. I don't mind if it build from China but please give us a little bit quality not with cheap plastic!
customer_reviews.author: Dawish Nil

customer_reviews.title: Works great for large phones
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my constant train travel on the Amtrak from NY to D.C and this thing is awesome. The rubber feet on the bottom of the stand prevent my phone from sliding around or moving despite the jostling of the train car. It holds up my Pixel XL and iPhone 7 very well and i use it to hold up my phones while typing on a Bluetooth keyboard so I don't have to take my laptop out to type or write on the go.
customer_reviews.author: Alex3838

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I use this to hold the external monitor I had for work and it’s been a few months but no sign of it breaking down. I’m super happy about this product and how easy it is to carry around when I travel. Definitely recommend if you need it to hold your portable monitor screen!
customer_reviews.author: Raichu

customer_reviews.title: Probably good for 8 inch tablet or small cell phone but larger mobile devices
customer_reviews.text: I returned it the same day i received it. Felt cheaply built and its too small Had intended to use it for my Asus Zenscreen portable monitor. No way. This would not work with a 15 inch monitor. Stand would probably work better with a small tablet or cell phone.
customer_reviews.author: xavg

customer_reviews.title: buying agian
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this one and it worked well. I lost it and then purchased some others, admittedly, cheaper. They don't compare. This one is MUCH better, sturdier and a bit larger. I wish it were in a different color so it would be more noticeable against black.
customer_reviews.author: mezzovoce

customer_reviews.title: Great stand at an affordable price
customer_reviews.text: I love this tablet/phone stand. I work in public libraries teaching people how to use their devices - I used to have to hold their devices up the whole time while showing them, because laying it flat on the table resulted in glare from the overhead lights. It has several adjustments so you can have the device at different angles. It has a rubber strip at the bottom to give the devices something to grip, so you don't have to worry about them falling over when tapping them. So far, I have only used this on smartphones and smaller tablets, but I believe it would work for large tablets also.
customer_reviews.author: Chloe Noel

customer_reviews.title: too lightweight
customer_reviews.text: too light weight and my ipad with the case kept falling. I returned it and got a case with a stand. It would be ok for a cellphone or a tiny tablet but not good for a bigger tablet.
customer_reviews.author: ReviewDoc

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative to the Nintendo Switch's built in stand.
customer_reviews.text: As someone who still has their Gamecube, when I got my Switch I was concerned about the built-in kickstand because it's pretty fragile. So I ordered this as an alternative and it works perfectly! It doesn't slide around and it's the perfect size for a Switch. I haven't used it for a tablet but it also works well as a phone stand. It's sturdy and has different slots that change the angle your phone/tablet/switch is held at, and wide enough that anything under 12" wide won't fall backwards.
customer_reviews.author: dongpuncher

customer_reviews.title: Great product if you use your phone as a clock or tablet for recipes
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3 of these phone stands since I use my phone my alarm clock on my nightstand and as a clock at work. My phone would always slip and fall so I couldn't see what time it was since I use an alarm clock app. This stand folds up nicely so it can be taken with you to hotels or camping. It also helps hold your phone if your are cooking in the kitchen and using a recipe on your phone and don't want to touch your phone with messy finger. It will be our stocking suffers this year for our teenage kids.
customer_reviews.author: SnowboardDoug

customer_reviews.title: Portability
customer_reviews.text: What can you say about a tablet stand? I bought it to be able to prop up my iPad without having to keep it in a case all the time. The simple and compact design were the main features I was looking for, and I'm not disappointed.. It's easy to stick in a computer bag and have a stand wherever I go. Works great. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: JSiv

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little stand!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a different brand when I purchased this one and I'm glad I took the chance on them. This is a great product and fits tablets as well as phones. I have more of a phablet, and mine fits in very nicely. I will purchase a couple more to have on hand. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: J. G. Smerda

customer_reviews.title: Great multi-use stand
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because my Kindle Fire 10" case stand sucks. It will not hold itself up on smooth surfaces and I don't need an expensive stand so this little thing is perfect. $5.99 with free shipping, how can you beat that? Even with the protective case on my Kindle it still fits. 5 stars all around!
customer_reviews.author: ITAD Global

customer_reviews.title: Great stand, very compact
customer_reviews.text: Great kickstand, perfect for phone or small tablet. It's about the width of my phone, so it looks great on the desk. Feels solid and well designed. Folds down compactly. Keep in mind, this is a very small stand, so the angles it can achieve are limited. They are marked on the unit as 75deg, 68deg, and 60deg, with adjustments between those for a total of 5 positions. They are all fairly steep. I use it at it's furthest incline, 60deg. 75deg feels almost as if the phone is standing straight up.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph D. Lyman

customer_reviews.title: Compact
customer_reviews.text: This is really good stand. I use it for my Kindle Fire and my Galaxy S8 phone. Both fit well in the holder. It's much better than having that goofy looking awkward button on the back of your phone. And it really folds flat enough to make it easy to carry with you.
customer_reviews.author: john j meyer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect lightweight stand
customer_reviews.text: Does exactly what it says and more. I have no trouble supporting my 10" iPad on most stable surfaces, at any of the several viewing angles that the stand has. Besides, this stand is ridiculously lightweight, just about as light as the simple 2 arm that I've carried around for a few years. But this one is more stable and less liable to break, since it folds so completely. I love it
customer_reviews.author: Brook

customer_reviews.title: Great stand
customer_reviews.text: I purchase this for my grandma she recently received a tablet for her birthday and she loves it. She spends the day looking for knitting patterns and making all sort of goodies for all her grandkids. She was having trouble keeping the table straight while she watched instructional videos on ''how to do''. She loves this stand it fits both her phone and tablet perfect she is able to completely fold it flat for easy storage and taking it on the go with her. It's made with strong plastic, and it has different level to adjust.
customer_reviews.author: RiRi

customer_reviews.title: I rarely give 5 stars. Best phone stand I've ever had
customer_reviews.text: This is my third stand for my cell phone but my first for this type and I think it's great. It's adjustable and folds flat to slip in a pocket, bookbag, or purse. My husband, son and I all have this type. You won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: C. Williams

customer_reviews.title: One of the best Phone stands I've ever purchased!
customer_reviews.text: The best one I've ever had! I bought this 3 full years ago and still hasn't failed! I use it every night on my nightstand to have a youtube video playing at night or have relaxing audio at night and it has been by my side ever since! Can't go on vaca or business trips without it! It's an AMAZING Nintendo Switch holder for anytime I need a quick stand to hold the tablet either during a trip out and about or during a flight, it's always been a treat to have on trips. A totally cheap and worthy buy!
customer_reviews.author: Blake

customer_reviews.title: Very nice little stand for my iPad or phone!!!
customer_reviews.text: Wow, i will be 100% honest....i wasn't expecting great things from this because of the price but it is probably the best or at least one of the best stands that you can get for your phone or tablet! It's very sturdy and i also like how you have the choice of changing the level of the angle for better viewing, so, i really like that. I'll be buy from this seller again in the future! :)
customer_reviews.author: Toni M.

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy Plastic Stand
customer_reviews.text: I'm not new to the MoKo product line, but I can't recommend this stand. Pros: small, foldable, easy for travel, adjustable angles Cons: flimsy, made of plastic material, doesn't stay in some slots that you adjust it
customer_reviews.author: Hawkstv

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding....
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in 2017. It has travelled with me to at least 15 countries and still standing strong. This is the best made mobile stand ever! The adjustability of the stand is very supportive, strong from holding mobile phones to pad....to be small and foldable its presence is mighty...ordering two now for my peeps that love mine! Price has definitely dropped since my purchase...
customer_reviews.author: Kunani J

customer_reviews.title: Fragile
customer_reviews.text: I’ve only had this a couple of months. I only use it occasionally and keep it in my tech bag. Today, just out of no where, it broke. I didn’t drop or bend it. This thing is too fragile for its intended purpose which was to hold up my phone, nevertheless someone’s tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Evelyn Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Loved it!!
customer_reviews.text: Love it so much gave it to my daughter for my grandson and he got into her purse and now we can’t find it.......lol! It WAS sturdy and he tried to break it but he couldn’t ......lol! We got another type but it wasn’t as good as this one!!
customer_reviews.author: forevablessed13

customer_reviews.title: works perfectly to hold my ipad pro 11 1/2 inch 2020 model
customer_reviews.text: I have tried others, but they do not handle the weight or balence the device well. This is lightweight, stable and very compact for travel. Couldn’t be happier! It also fits easily with a silicone back case on the back of the device
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Great little stand!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to hold my iPhone 6. The stand is a lot smaller than I had expected since the description said it was for a tablet but it is perfect for a phone. My only criticism is I wish the the inclined back would snap into it place, it just rests in the notches and if you pick the stand up by the inclined section it comes out of the notches and you have to reset it, not a huge deal but just enough for me to knock off one star, probably rate closer to 4.5 stars if I could.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: The best one out there
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. There's so many like it, but this is the best one out there. It's small, compatible, foldable, and has more than one adjustment. It's plastic, but it feels sturdy and thick. And then there's a small foam to keep your electronic in place.
customer_reviews.author: Christal

customer_reviews.title: Good stand
customer_reviews.text: A good light weight compact stand. It folds up nicely flat as well. It will hold anything reasonable well, the notches are sturdy enough. All plastic construction makes it a little flimsy feeling but for a phone/small tablet is fine, plastic is lightweight and doesn't scratch as easily as well.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Abootman

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and convienient
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent, small cell phone stand that fits comfortably into your shirt pocket. I bought Moko's stand because it was sturdier than others but also bought others of the same design to place around the house. It holds my LG Sylos 2 phone with case we'll and in several positions, but for me is too small for my For tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Frank A. Vaughan

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly Sturdy; I like it!
customer_reviews.text: So far I really like this stand! I thought it would be made of cheap plastic and flimsy but to my surprise it’s really sturdy and I like that it lays flats and doesn’t take up much rooms. I give it 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Kurtz

customer_reviews.title: Simple, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I really needed a phone stand because I was tired of holding my mobile while viewing content. I wanted something very simple and easy to use. Looks just as pictured. I have used it for about two weeks and so far so good. I also wanted the little ones to be able to sit down and video chat with relatives without holding the phone. So far, so good. Definitely worth a try.
customer_reviews.author: NMCX

customer_reviews.title: This Thing is Great for Work
customer_reviews.text: I needed a stand for my phone so that while I'm eating lunch at work I don't have to lean my phone on the paper towel holder to read a book. This was a great value and does exactly what I need it to do. And it folds up and easily fits in a pocket for storage. If you use your phone for literally anything where you need to set it up to see it, use this. It'll change your life.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Rogier

customer_reviews.title: Great for phone; not really for a tablet
customer_reviews.text: Just got it in the mail and is perfect for my phone. I have an Ottorbox symmetry case on my IPhone 7plus and the case could even be thicker and still work perfect. I got it specifically for my phone. This wouldn't be ideal for a tablet though as it is more sized for a phone; so if your looking for a tablet stand I would recommend something else.
customer_reviews.author: adrienne

customer_reviews.title: Small, flimsy and a joke.
customer_reviews.text: It made it seem like this was a sturdy stand. It’s not even 1/4 inch thick and the size is embarrassingly small. I bought it for my dad for Father’s Day and I’m embarrassed to give it. Not worth the money I spent!!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: biggest strongest little holder around
customer_reviews.text: i like every thing about this holder its compact has non slip little feet and a non slip strip on the base it will hold my iphone xr and my i pad but still small enough to slip into a pocket of my purse.
customer_reviews.author: wilma Brucker

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: The stand works fine and is simple to use. It folds flat and can be carried in a pocket or purse when not in use. If the stand could be adjusted to a flatter position when used it would be better.
customer_reviews.author: JimBeam

customer_reviews.title: Magnificent device!
customer_reviews.text: I love this little stand it is perfect for my iPhone XAnd works just as well on My Amazon Fire 8” tablet. I tested it on my friends 10” Fire tablet and found it was very stable even with that unit!
customer_reviews.author: Casbeer

customer_reviews.title: Small, light, sturdy - what's not to like?
customer_reviews.text: While not the smallest stand available. I love this one. It is extremely sturdy, easy to open and easy to close. It offers 5 different viewing angles, and it has anti-skid pads that prevent it from sliding around when you touch your devices display. I am using this with an iPhone 7 Plus and a keyboard, which in combination now replaced my iPad mini. I can't judge how well this would work with a large tablet, but for the bigger phone it is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Phoebus

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product, and no I didnt get payed to say that. It fits perfectly in the tiny side pocket of my tablet sheath and when setup hold the table firmly enough in place for typing and browsing. It has a snug and safe fit without needing any special clips or anything. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Schultz

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, nicely compact
customer_reviews.text: Love that this has small rubberized grips that appear to be high quality. All hinges are true 'pin-hinges' made of separately molded plastic with a metal pin. This is the way to go! Nice and compact and great for travel - strong enough to throw in a bag without much worry.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Really like the stand
customer_reviews.text: I am able to use this even with a case on my phone. It really works well for me. I use my phone to do school work with a wireless keyboard and the stand is great, you can use the phone straight up or side ways. I would definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Emisha Rodriguez Dickey

customer_reviews.title: Very small
customer_reviews.text: It's much smaller than it seems on the picture. I got it for a kindle fire, my daughter prefers the one from the dollar store, so I use it for my phone. The size is more appropriate for a phone than for a tablet. On the upside: If folds flat so it is easy to store in my purse and take along.
customer_reviews.author: Trish B.

customer_reviews.title: Stand Up For This Bargain
customer_reviews.text: The Moko Cell phone Stand /Tablet stand is well made. Small enough to fold up and fit into your pocket. Makes it easy with any cell phone or tablets to view hands free. has several adjustable positions. has a grip where your phone or tablet lays in the stand and a non slip grip on the bottom of the stand. Very clever design, well constructed.
customer_reviews.author: tinman

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Got this stand about three months ago, use it almost every day at work with the Samsung Galaxy Tab S2 8" tablet. It works perfectly. The only inconvenience is that the widest angle is about 57 degrees - sometimes I wish I could open it wider so the tablet would be lower. But I understand that it would require to make the stand bigger and I don't want that either because with the current size I can easily fit it in my pocket. I think the current design is a good balance between the size of the stand and its maximum angle.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Small but sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: For such a small stand it does the job perfectly I thought it was much bigger because I couldn't tell by the picture but when we got it and we used it it is wonderful I've definitely Would buy another one
customer_reviews.author: John C

product_meta.title: MoKo Phone/Tablet Stand, Foldable Desktop Holder Fit with iPhone 11 Pro Max/11 Pro/11, iPhone Xs/Xs Max/Xr/X, iPhone SE 2020, iPad Pro 11 2020/10.2/Air 3/Mini 5, Galaxy S20 6.2", Black
product_meta.description:
Color:BlackFeatures:
Support your device in both portrait and landscape mode 
Angle adjustable and multifunctional for viewing, gaming or typing
Compact, lightweight, Strong, durable, foldable, portable
Simply and easily to use and easily pack away when not in use
Compatible with any smartphone and tablet PC up to 11 INes

Note:
Will not fit for Smartphone/Tablet with a case or sleeve.
When using for a tablet or a phone, it is suggested to set the tablet horizontally on the stand for a better performance.

Compatibilitone, E-reader, Tablet(6-11 IN) and more.

iPhone 11 Pro Max 6.5", iPhone 11 Pro 5.8", iPhone 11 6.1", iPad 7th Gen 10.2" 2019, New iPad 9.7 2018/2017, iPad Pro 11 2018, iPad Pro 10.5 / 9.7, New iPad Air 3 10.5" 2019, iPad Mini 5 7.9" 2019, iPad Mini 4 / 3 / 2 / 1, iPad Air 2/1, iPad 4 / 3 / 2 / 1,iPhone X, iPhone 8 / 8 Plus/ 7 / 7 Plus / SE / 6s / 6s Plus / 6 / 6 Plus / 5S, iPod Touch / Shuffle / Nano / Classic

Android: Samsung Galaxy Note 10 Plus 6.8"/Note 10 6.3", Galaxy S10e 5.8", S10 6.1", S10 Plus 6.4", Galaxy S9, S9 Plus, Note 8, Note9, S8, S8 Plus, Galaxy Tab E 9.6 / Tab S3 / Tab 3 10.1 8.0 7.0 / P5200 P5210 P5220, Motorola G5 Plus / G4 / E4 / Z2 Play / Droid Turbo 2, ASUS ZenFone 2 / 3, Google Pixel / Pixel XL, Nexus 7, Nexus 10, Nexus 4, Nexus 5, BLU R1 HD / BLU Advance 5.0 / BLU Studio X8, Sony Xperia Z5 / XZ / XA1, LG G5, Alcatel etc.

Windows Devices and others: Nokia Lumia 1520 1320 1020 930, GPS etc.

Nintendo Switch without any protective cover case.
feature_bullets: Extremely lightweight(1.76oz) and pocket-sized(4.05*3.34*0.27in), folds up to a completely flat shape, easily thrown onto a rucksack/bag.
Six fully adjustable slots, easily adjusts stand angle, supporting both vertical and horizontal viewing, displaying portrait and landscape modes.
Strong and durable ABS and rubber ensures stability, holds devices up to 11 IN.
Well placed rubber pads for surface protection protects tablet from scratches and sliding.

Fit for Phone/E-reader/Tablet(6-11 IN), such as iPhone SE 2020, iPhone 11 Pro Max 6.5", 11 Pro 5.8", 11 6.1", iPad Pro 11-inch (2nd Gen), iPad 7th Gen 10.2" 2019/ Air 3/Mini 5, Galaxy S20 6.2", Galaxy Note 10 Plus 6.8/Note 10 6.3, Google Pixel 4 5.7", Pixel 4XL 6.3", will not fit tablet/phone with a case or sleeve.
